Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Nan's Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Nan's nostalgic feelings for the Old West, her connection to Ghost Town, and the conflict arising from modern development plans threatening its existence, intertwined with personal relationships and emotional journeys.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Introductions and Ghost Town Theme
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of characters in a saloon setting, establishing Nan's nostalgia and a disagreement about visiting Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Woman's Nostalgia
Bar Conversation and Ghost Town Disagreement

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Ghost Town and Development Threat
sub_scenes.description: Nan arrives at Ghost Town and overhears plans for its destruction to build an airport, sparking her emotional reaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Solo Ride to Ghost Town
Modern Visitors and Airport Development Plan
Nan Overhears the Airport Plan and Reacts

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Past Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Nan reflects on her past relationship with Cal, triggered by her distress over the ghost town's fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts construction workers at Ghost Town, leading to a physical altercation and danger.

sub_scenes.title: Family Conflict Over Business and Airport
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions ensue, revealing Nan's father's opposition to the airport and escalating to a personal conflict with Nan.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Horses and Father's Disapproval

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Guidance and Business Obligations
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives conflicting advice and then takes action, pursuing Cal and dealing with urgent business related to the airport construction.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Determination and Pursuit of Cal
Business Deal with Cowboys and Urgency

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Crisis and Confession
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal, leading to an ultimatum, departure, time skip, and a belated confession of feelings after a period of loneliness.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: A severe weather warning interrupts Nan and Cal's conversation, shifting focus to a community-wide crisis and collective action.

sub_scenes.title: Hope and Relief Amidst the Storm
sub_scenes.description: The community experiences emotional swings from despair to hope as they face the weather crisis, culminating in unexpected aid from the airport.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: The Fodder Plane
Assessing the Situation and Lingering Concerns

Major_Arcs.title: Chane Benson and Jeff's Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and focuses on his forceful character, the reactions he provokes, and his negative influence on young Jeff, leading to a confrontation and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Character Perspectives
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through a display of force, and bystanders offer conflicting opinions on his character and methods.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dangerous Casanova's Display of Force
Conflicting Views on Chane Benson's Heroism and Manners
Beyond Brute Force: Maturity and Civilization

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Character and Mother's Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Conversations reveal concerns about Jeff's unhealthy obsession with guns and the negative influence of figures like Chane Benson, leading to a confrontation with his mother.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing about Brother Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship
Initiating a Talk about Jeff's Gun Handling
Mother's Disappointment and Desire for Decency
Comparison to Chane Benson and Criticism of Clyde Surrett
Defense of Chane Benson and Mocking Duel with Clyde Surrett

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Resolve and Introduction of Sally and Mr. Benson
sub_scenes.description: The mother resolves to help Jeff, while Sally and Mr. Benson are introduced, further exploring the influence of Chane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Shared Responsibility for Jeff's Upbringing
Affection and Hope for Future Happiness
Reflection on Blissful Ignorance and Looming Trouble
Advice from Mr. Benson to Sally
Chane Benson's Cold Demeanor and Silent Observation
Rejection of Brother's Influence and Disdain for Young Boys

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Chane Benson and Newspaper's Stand
sub_scenes.description: Clyde and Surrett confront Chane Benson, questioning his intentions and declaring the newspaper's opposition to his influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Questioning of Benson's Intentions
Benson's Evasive Response and Assertion of Staying
Clyde's Intervention and Warning to Benson
Surrett's Further Inquiry and Clyde's Resolve to Stay
Clyde's Declaration of Action and Protection

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Tense Dinner Scene
sub_scenes.description: Sally invites Chane Benson to dinner, leading to a tense dinner scene where Benson demonstrates his shooting skills.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Benson and Dinner Invitation
Narrative Reflection on Decency and Courtesy
Narrative Time Skip and Jeff's Shift in Viewpoint
Dinner Shooting Demonstration and Sally's Concern

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Aftermath and Escalating Conflict
sub_scenes.description: The dinner concludes, but tensions escalate outdoors with accusations, forced affection, and Sally's strong rebuke of Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Physical Fight and Escape
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Benson's verbal conflict escalates into a physical fight, followed by Jeff's escape and a nighttime confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane Benson's Provocation and Jeff's Anger
Sally's Urgency and the Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: Duel and Resolution with Benson
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Benson agree to a duel, leading to a tense wait and Jeff's eventual victory and Benson's departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Headline Change and Relief at Return

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Ranch Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the introduction of Steve Daley at the ranch, the escalating ranch concerns, and the romantic development between Betsy and Steve, culminating in their commitment.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction at the Ranch and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of ranch setting and characters Steve Daley and Betsy, highlighting initial ranch conflicts and concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and the Boss
Explanation of Steve's Hiring and Approval

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Life and Town Orders
sub_scenes.description: Ranch life continues with accommodation arrangements and town errands, while ranch concerns and warnings escalate.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Long Lady's Strength
sub_scenes.description: Long Lady's trip to town leads to observation and confrontation, showcasing her unexpected strength and resolve.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Ranch Decisions and Romantic Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Betsy makes firm decisions about ranch management and gunmen, while her romantic feelings for Steve Daley develop.

sub_scenes.title: Steve and Betsy's Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve resolve conflicts about his profession, confess their love, and commit to a future together.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and the Dilemma of Profession

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve's Past
sub_scenes.description: A confrontation with Bridges and his men occurs at the ranch, prompting Steve to reflect on his past and foreshadow future action.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Bridges and his Men

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Departure and Betsy's Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Steve decides to arm himself and confront danger, leading to Betsy's distressed reaction and pursuit to Devil's Pass.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Decision to Arm Himself and Go to Devil's Pass
Betsy's Realization and Pursuit of Steve

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Gunfight and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Arrival at Devil's Pass leads to a gunfight, Betsy's shock and fainting, and a tender reconciliation between Betsy and Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Dave, Carrie and Fred's Romantic Triangle
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the romantic entanglements of Dave, Carrie, and Fred Gordon, exploring misunderstandings, past relationships, and eventual reconciliation and marriage.

sub_scenes.title: Argument about Dave
sub_scenes.description: An initial argument sets the stage for the unfolding drama involving Dave and Carrie.

sub_scenes.title: Troubling Ranch News
sub_scenes.description: Ranch news introduces a separate conflict, running parallel to the romantic tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubling News at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Range War Confrontation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: A confrontation over range and cattle occurs, leading to expulsion of intruders and resolution of ranch conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion Among Intruders and Threat of Gunplay

sub_scenes.title: Dave and Carrie's Reconciliation and Fred's Intrusion
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie reconcile, but their moment is interrupted by Fred Gordon, creating new tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Fred and Brotherly Matters
Carrie's Introspective Thoughts on Love and Anticipation
Intrusion and Questioning by Fred Gordon

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation, Reflection and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie reconcile, reflect on past relationships, and move towards a marriage proposal and acceptance.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Rebuttal and Declaration of Love
Desire for Reconciliation and Invitation for Relaxation
Carrie's Reflection on Love for Fred and His Qualities
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Marriage Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Conflict and Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Conflict arises over the Carlton contract, leading to accusations, reflections on manipulation, and a multi-character confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation of Deception and Plea of Love
Confrontation with Dave, Pete, and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Carlton and Emotional Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton, asserts her independence, and experiences emotional release and reconciliation with Dave and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Encounters and Reflections
sub_scenes.description: Fred reflects on Carrie's words, leading to a town encounter between Dave and Carrie, and further emotional revelations.

narrative_arcs.title: Chance Encounter and Emotional Inquiry in Town

sub_scenes.title: Revelation and Reunion with Fred
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's sickbed scene reveals the truth about the beef contract, leading to emotional reunion and romantic climax with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Young Man's Confession and Carrie's Initial Reaction
Carrie's Flashback of Shame, Regret, and Happiness

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Final Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Final resolution at the wedding day, despite Dirk's unexpected appearance, leading to praise and a happy ending.

narrative_arcs.title: Acclamation and Anecdotal Praise for Rance

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Conflict and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the conflict and chase between Dirk and Rance, culminating in a shootout, escape, and eventual reconciliation in Mexico.

sub_scenes.title: Rance Cready's Ranch Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Rance Cready and his ranch, setting up the search for Dirk and escalating tension at the ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Encounter with Chris Ransome
Escalating Tension and Accusation at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Lawman's Arrival and Negotiation
sub_scenes.description: The Lawman arrives, revealing Dirk's crime and negotiating for his custody, while experiencing internal conflict and emotional shift.

narrative_arcs.title: Negotiation for Dirk's Custody and Care
Lawman's Internal Conflict and Shifting Perspective

sub_scenes.title: Chris and Rance's Romantic Interlude and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance have a romantic interlude, but Chris secretly plans to help Dirk escape, leading to rejection and firm decisions.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Desire and Lingering Doubt
Realization of Rejection and Internal Conflict
Confrontation about Intentions and Daybreak Departure

sub_scenes.title: The Pursuit and Shootout
sub_scenes.description: The pursuit of Dirk intensifies, leading to a direct confrontation, shootout, and Chris's intervention to protect Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Justification for Deadly Force and Injury Assessment
Desperate Escape Plan and Moral Objection

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Reunion in Mexico
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris escape, parting ways at the border, while Rance, despite injuries, pursues and reunites with Dirk in Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: Parting Ways and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery, Confession and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Rance is found injured, recovers at his ranch, and shares emotional and romantic moments with Chris, leading to a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Sleepless Vigil and Lingering Danger
Father's Tactful Exit and Anticipation of Private Discussion
Clarification of Father's Integrity and Dirk's Involvement
Declaration of Gratitude and Undying Affection
